ai-tha-ap491:1.2_0: I answer the one who speaks from such a person.
ai-tha-ap491:1.3_0: ‘Venerable Sir, this is allowable for us
ai-tha-ap491:3.3_0: on the bank of the Awakened One,
ai-tha-ap491:3.4_0: With Bāhiya of the Great Snakes,
ai-tha-ap491:4.4_0: I’ll attend on me to the victor.
ai-tha-ap491:5.3_0: And the mind is as predatory animals,
ai-tha-ap491:6.2_0: for the sake of all beings.
ai-tha-ap491:6.3_0: Of this hero, the Awakening One,
ai-tha-ap491:6.4_0: is said to be the best.’
ai-tha-ap491:7.2_0: even if they’re really a fool,
ai-tha-ap491:7.4_0: they revere him with joined palms:
ai-tha-ap491:8.1_0: Then I was a young brāhmaṇa,
ai-tha-ap491:8.3_0: After hearing the best teaching, the merchant,
ai-tha-ap491:11.2_0: by anyone or by bad friends.
ai-tha-ap491:11.4_0: I’ve served the variety of paths.
ai-tha-ap491:12.1_0: it is about and not losing it,
ai-tha-ap491:13.3_0: passed away from there and great hero,
ai-tha-ap491:14.1_0: to the underworld of the lower realms,
ai-tha-ap491:14.4_0: I worship the one who is mortary,
ai-tha-ap491:15.3_0: Having seen (that), she amused herself in the city of Sāketa.
ai-tha-ap491:15.4_0: I went to a good family.
ai-tha-ap491:16.1_0: Having seen (that), the Lord of the World gains
ai-tha-ap491:16.4_0: When they hear a teaching, they cried.
ai-tha-ap491:18.3_0: Seeing the light of the world,
ai-tha-ap491:19.1_0: Having gone to the Great Wood, she,
ai-tha-ap491:19.3_0: I three times I was the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap491:20.1_0: Then after seeing that sage, she said:
ai-tha-ap491:20.2_0: Remember me a long time, please tell me Dhamma.”
ai-tha-ap491:21.1_0: For the one with excellent marks of merits,
ai-tha-ap491:21.4_0: Only I see your own flesh,
ai-tha-ap491:23.1_0: “Having been taken by you for a long time.”
ai-tha-ap491:23.4_0: They won’t grant the ascetic Gotama;
ai-tha-ap491:25.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap491:27.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Uruvelā.
